member.name: T:DolbyIO.Comms.ConferenceAccessPermissions
member.summary: The ConferenceAccessPermissions enum contains the available permissions for application users who are invited to a conference.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.ConferenceAccessPermissions.Invite
member.summary: Allows a participant to invite other participants to a conference.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.ConferenceAccessPermissions.Join
member.summary: Allows a participant to join a conference.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.ConferenceAccessPermissions.SendAudio
member.summary: Allows a participant to send an audio stream during a conference.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.ConferenceAccessPermissions.SendVideo
member.summary: Allows a participant to send a video stream during a conference.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.ConferenceAccessPermissions.ShareScreen
member.summary: Allows a participant to share their screen during a conference.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.ConferenceAccessPermissions.ShareVideo
member.summary: Allows a participant to share a video file during a conference.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.ConferenceAccessPermissions.ShareFile
member.summary: Allows a participant to share a file during a conference.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.ConferenceAccessPermissions.SendMessage
member.summary: Allows a participant to send a message to other participants during a conference.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.ConferenceAccessPermissions.Record
member.summary: Allows a participant to record a conference.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.ConferenceAccessPermissions.Stream
member.summary: Allows a participant to stream a conference.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.ConferenceAccessPermissions.Kick
member.summary: Allows a participant to kick other participants from a conference.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.ConferenceAccessPermissions.UpdatePermissions
member.summary: Allows a participant to update permissions of other participants.

member.name: T:DolbyIO.Comms.ConferenceStatus
member.summary: The ConferenceStatus enum gathers possible statuses of a conference.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.ConferenceStatus.Creating
member.summary: The SDK is creating a new conference.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.ConferenceStatus.Created
member.summary: The conference is created.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.ConferenceStatus.Joining
member.summary: The local participant is joining a conference.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.ConferenceStatus.Joined
member.summary: The local participant successfully joined the conference.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.ConferenceStatus.Leaving
member.summary: The local participant is leaving the conference.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.ConferenceStatus.Left
member.summary: The local participant left the conference.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.ConferenceStatus.Destroyed
member.summary: The conference is destroyed on the Dolby.io server.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.ConferenceStatus.Error
member.summary: A conference error occurred.

member.name: T:DolbyIO.Comms.DeviceDirection
member.summary: The DeviceDirection enum gathers the possible types of devices.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.DeviceDirection.None
member.summary: A device that does not capture or play audio.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.DeviceDirection.Input
member.summary: A device that captures audio, for example, a microphone.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.DeviceDirection.Output
member.summary: A device that plays audio, for example, a speaker.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.DeviceDirection.Both
member.summary: A device that captures and plays audio, for example, a headset.

member.name: T:DolbyIO.Comms.LogLevel
member.summary: The LogLevel enum gathers logging levels to set. The logging levels allow classifying the entries in the log files in terms of urgency to help to control the amount of logged information.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.LogLevel.Off
member.summary: Disables logging.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.LogLevel.Error
member.summary: Generates logs only when an error occurs that does not allow the SDK to function properly.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.LogLevel.Warning
member.summary: Generates logs when the SDK detects an unexpected problem but is still able to work as usual.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.LogLevel.Info
member.summary: Generates an informative number of logs.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.LogLevel.Debug
member.summary: Generates a high number of logs to provide diagnostic information in a detailed manner.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.LogLevel.Verbose
member.summary: Generates the highest number of logs, including HTTP requests.

member.name: T:DolbyIO.Comms.ParticipantStatus
member.summary: The ParticipantStatus enum gathers the possible statuses of a conference participant.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.ParticipantStatus.Reserved
member.summary: The participant has been invited to a conference and is waiting for an invitation.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.ParticipantStatus.Connecting
member.summary: The participant has received a conference invitation and is connecting to the conference.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.ParticipantStatus.OnAir
member.summary: The participant has successfully connected to the conference.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.ParticipantStatus.Decline
member.summary: The invited participant has declined the conference invitation.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.ParticipantStatus.Inactive
member.summary: The participant does not send any audio, video, or screen-share stream to the conference.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.ParticipantStatus.Left
member.summary: The participant has left the conference.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.ParticipantStatus.Warning
member.summary: The participant is experiencing a peer connection problem.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.ParticipantStatus.Error
member.summary: The participant cannot connect to the conference due to a peer connection failure.

member.name: T:DolbyIO.Comms.ParticipantType
member.summary: The ParticipantType enum gathers the possible participant types.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.ParticipantType.User
member.summary: The participant who can send and receive an audio and video stream during a conference.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.ParticipantType.Listener
member.summary: The participant who can receive audio and video streams, but cannot send any stream to a conference.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.ParticipantType.Speaker
member.summary: A deprecated type.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.ParticipantType.PSTN
member.summary: A participant who connected to the conference using Public Switched Telephone Network (PSTN).

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.ParticipantType.Mixer
member.summary: A special participant who joins a conference to record it.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.ParticipantType.DVCS
member.summary: A deprecated type.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.ParticipantType.None
member.summary: A participant who does not have an assigned type.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.ParticipantType.Robot
member.summary: A USER who is present during a replay of a recorded conference.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.ParticipantType.RobotSpeaker
member.summary: A deprecated type.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.ParticipantType.RobotListener
member.summary: A LISTENER who is present during a replay of a recorded conference.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.ParticipantType.RobotPSTN
member.summary: A PSTN participant who is present during a replay of a recorded conference.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.ParticipantType.RobotMixer
member.summary: A MIXER who is present during a replay of a recorded conference.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.ParticipantType.RobotNone
member.summary: A participant who does not have an assigned type during a replay of a recorded conference.

member.name: T:DolbyIO.Comms.SpatialAudioStyle
member.summary: The SpatialAudioStyle enum gathers the possible spatial audio styles of the conference. Setting SpatialAudioStyle is possible only if the DolbyVoice flag is set to true.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.SpatialAudioStyle.None
member.summary: Disables spatial audio in a conference.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.SpatialAudioStyle.Individual
member.summary: Sets the spatial location that is based on the spatial scene, local participant's position, and remote participants' positions. This allows a client to control the position using the local, self-contained logic. However, the client has to communicate a large set of requests constantly to the server, which increases network traffic, log subsystem pressure, and complexity of the client-side application. This option is selected by default. We recommend this mode for A/V congruence scenarios in video conferencing and similar applications.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.SpatialAudioStyle.Shared
member.summary:
Sets the spatial location that is based on the spatial scene and the local participant's position, while the relative positions among participants are calculated by the Dolby.io server. This way, the spatial scene is shared by all participants, so that each client can set a position and participate in the shared scene. This approach simplifies communication between the client and the server and decreases network traffic. We recommend this mode for virtual space scenarios, such as 2D or 3D games, trade shows, virtual museums, water cooler scenarios, etc.
**Note**: The shared style currently does not support recording conferences.

member.name: T:DolbyIO.Comms.ListenMode
member.summary: The listening mode for listeners.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.ListenMode.Regular
member.summary: Receive multiple streams.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.ListenMode.RtsMixed
member.summary: Receive a realtime mixed stream.

member.name: T:DolbyIO.Comms.ScreenShareType
member.summary: The possible screen share source types.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.ScreenShareType.Screen
member.summary: Entire monitor or display screen.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.ScreenShareType.Window
member.summary: Single applicaton window.

member.summary: The VideoFrame object wraps the decoded ARGB8888 video frames.

member.summary: The width of the video frame.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.VideoFrame.Height
member.summary: The height of the video frame.

member.name: M:DolbyIO.Comms.VideoFrame.GetBuffer
member.summary: Gets a copy of the native video frame as a byte array.
member.returns: A byte array containing the video frame.

member.summary: An Internal representation of an identity.

members.member:
The AudioDevice class contains a platform-agnostic description of an audio device.
@ingroup device_management

member.summary: The unique identifier of the audio device.
member.returns: The identifier.

member.summary: The name of the audio device.
member.returns: The name of the device.

member.summary: Information whether the device is the input or output device.
member.returns: Information whether the device is the input or output device.

member.name: T:DolbyIO.Comms.Conference
member.summary: The Conference class contains information about a conference. This structure provides conference details that are required to join a specific conference. The SDK returns Conference to describe the created or joined conference.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.Conference.Id
member.summary: The unique conference identifier.
member.returns: The conference identifier.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.Conference.Alias
member.summary: The conference alias. The alias must be a logical and unique string that consists of up to 250 characters, such as letters, digits, and symbols other than #. The alias is case insensitive, which means that using "foobar" and "FOObar" aliases refers to the same conference. The alias is optional in the case of using the conference ID.
member.returns: The conference alias.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.Conference.IsNew
member.summary: A boolean that indicates whether the conference represented by the object has been just created.
member.returns: If true, the conference is new.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.Conference.Status
member.summary: The current status of the conference.
member.returns: The conference status.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.Conference.SpatialAudioStyle
member.summary: The spatial audio style used in the joined conference.
member.returns: The spatial audio style.

member.name: P:DolbyIO.Comms.Conference.Permissions
member.summary: Permissions that allow a conference participant to perform limited actions during a protected conference.
member.returns: The conference permissions.

member.name: T:DolbyIO.Comms.ConferenceOptions
member.summary: The ConferenceOptions class provides additional information about a conference.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.ConferenceOptions.Params
member.summary: The conference parameters.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.ConferenceOptions.Alias
member.summary: The conference alias.

member.name: T:DolbyIO.Comms.ConferenceParams
member.summary: The ConferenceParams class gathers conference parameters.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.ConferenceParams.DolbyVoice
member.summary: A boolean value that indicates whether the SDK should create a Dolby Voice conference where each participant receives one audio stream.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.ConferenceParams.Stats
member.summary: A boolean that indicates whether the conference should include additional statistics.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.ConferenceParams.SpatialAudioStyle
member.summary: An enum that defines how the spatial location is communicated between the SDK and the Dolby.io server.

member.name: T:DolbyIO.Comms.ConnectionOptions
member.summary: The ConnectionOptions class contains options that define how the application expects to join a conference in terms of media preference.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.ConnectionOptions.MaxVideoForwarding
member.summary: The maximum number of video streams that may be transmitted to the SDK. Valid parameter values are between 0 and 25.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.ConnectionOptions.ConferenceAccessToken
member.summary: The conference access token that is required to join a protected conference if the conference is created using the [create](ref:conference#operation-create-conference) REST API. While calling the join or listen method, the application has to externally fetch the token and provide it to the SDK.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.ConnectionOptions.SpatialAudio
member.summary: A boolean that enables spatial audio for the joining participant. This boolean must be set to true if spatial audio style is enabled. For more information, refer to our sample application code.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.ConnectionOptions.Simulcast
member.summary: Enables simulcast support in the conference.

member.name: T:DolbyIO.Comms.JoinOptions
member.summary: The JoinOptions class gathers options for joining a conference as a user who can send and receive media.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.JoinOptions.Connection
member.summary: The options for connecting to the conference.
member.returns: The connection options.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.JoinOptions.Constraints
member.summary: The media constraints for the user.
member.returns: The media constraints.

member.name: T:DolbyIO.Comms.ListenOptions
member.summary: The ListenOptions class gathers options for joining a conference as listener who can only receive media.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.ListenOptions.Connection
member.summary: The options for connecting to the conference.
member.returns: The connection options.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.ListenOptions.Mode
member.summary: The listening mode.

member.name: T:DolbyIO.Comms.MediaConstraints
member.summary: The MediaConstraints class contains the local media constraints for an application joining a conference.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.MediaConstraints.Audio
member.summary: A boolean that indicates whether the application should capture the local audio and send it to the conference.
member.returns: If true, the SDK will capture audio and send it to the conference.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.MediaConstraints.Video
member.summary: A boolean that indicates whether the application should capture the local video and send it to the conference.
member.returns: If true, the SDK will capture the local video and send it to the conference.

member.name: F:DolbyIO.Comms.MediaConstraints.SendOnly
member.summary: A boolean that allows a participant to join a conference as a sender. This is strictly intended for Server Side SDK applications that want to inject media without recording. This flag is ignored by the Client SDK applications.

members.member: Native Interop for the Dolby.io Communications C++ SDK @nodocument

member.name: T:DolbyIO.Comms.Services.SessionService
member.summary:
The session service is responsible for connecting the SDK with the Dolby.io backend by opening and closing sessions.
To use the session service, follow these steps: 1. Open a session using the method. 2. Join a conference using the . 3. Leave the conference and close the session using the method.

member.name: P:DolbyIO.Comms.Services.SessionService.User
member.summary: Gets the local participant object that belongs to the current session.
member.returns: The UserInfo class that contains information about the participant who opened the session.

member.name: P:DolbyIO.Comms.Services.SessionService.IsOpen
member.summary: Gets if a session is currently open.
member.value: true if a session is open; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:DolbyIO.Comms.Services.SessionService.OpenAsync(DolbyIO.Comms.UserInfo)
member.summary: Opens a new session for the specified participant.
member.param: Information about the participant who opens the session.
member.returns: The that represents the asynchronous open operation. The property returns the object representing the participant who opened the session.

member.name: M:DolbyIO.Comms.Services.SessionService.CloseAsync
member.summary: Closes the current session.
member.returns: A that represents the asynchronous operation.

member.name: T:DolbyIO.Comms.Services.ConferenceService
member.summary:
The conference service allows joining and leaving conferences as well as subscribing to conference events.
To use the conference service, follow these steps: 1. Open a session using from the .. 2. Subscribe to events exposed through the service, for example and . 3. Create a conference using the method. 4. Join the created conference using the method or use the method to join the conference as a listener. 5. Leave the conference using the method.

member.name: M:DolbyIO.Comms.Services.ConferenceService.SetSpatialEnvironmentAsync(System.Numerics.Vector3,System.Numerics.Vector3,System.Numerics.Vector3,System.Numerics.Vector3)
member.summary:
Configures a spatial environment of an application, so the audio renderer understands which directions the application considers forward, up, and right and which units it uses for distance. This method is available only for participants who joined a conference using the join method with enabled spatial audio. To set a spatial environment for listeners, use the Set Spatial Listeners Audio REST API. If not called, the SDK uses the default spatial environment, which consists of the following values: - forward = (0, 0, 1), where +Z axis is in front - up = (0, 1, 0), where +Y axis is above - right = (1, 0, 0), where +X axis is to the right - scale = (1, 1, 1), where one unit on any axis is 1 meter
For more information about spatial audio, see the Spatial Audio guide.
member.param: A scale that defines how to convert units from the coordinate system of an application (pixels or centimeters) into meters used by the spatial audio coordinate system. For example, if SpatialScale is set to (100,100,100), it indicates that 100 of the applications units (cm) map to 1 meter for the audio coordinates. In such a case, if the listener's location is (0,0,0)cm and a remote participant's location is (200,200,200)cm, the listener has an impression of hearing the remote participant from the (2,2,2)m location.
A vector describing the direction the application considers as forward. The value can be either +1, 0, or -1 and must be orthogonal to up and right.
A vector describing the direction the application considers as up. The value can be either +1, 0, or -1 and must be orthogonal to forward and right.
A vector describing the direction the application considers as right. The value can be either +1, 0, or -1 and must be orthogonal to forward and up.
member.returns: A that represents the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:DolbyIO.Comms.Services.ConferenceService.SetSpatialDirectionAsync(System.Numerics.Vector3)
member.summary:
Sets the direction the local participant is facing in space. This method is available only for participants who joined the conference using the join method with enabled spatial audio. To set a spatial direction for listeners, use the Set Spatial Listeners Audio REST API.
If the local participant hears audio from the position (0,0,0) facing down the Z-axis and locates a remote participant in the position (1,0,1), the local participant hears the remote participant from their front-right. If the local participant chooses to change the direction they are facing and rotate +90 degrees about the Y-axis, then instead of hearing the speaker from the front-right position, they hear the speaker from the front-left position.
For more information about spatial audio, see the Spatial Audio guide.
member.param: The direction the local participant is facing in space.
member.returns: A that represents the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:DolbyIO.Comms.Services.ConferenceService.SetSpatialPositionAsync(System.String,System.Numerics.Vector3)
member.summary:
Sets a participant's position in space to enable the spatial audio experience during a Dolby Voice conference. This method is available only for participants who joined the conference using the join method with enabled spatial audio. To set a spatial position for listeners, use the Set Spatial Listeners Audio REST API.
Depending on the specified participant in the participant parameter, the setSpatialPosition method impacts the location from which audio is heard or from which audio is rendered: - When the specified participant is the local participant, setSpatialPosition sets a location from which the local participant listens to a conference. If the local participant does not have an established location, the participant hears audio from the default location (0, 0, 0). - When the specified participant is a remote participant, setSpatialPosition ensures the remote participant's audio is rendered from the specified location in space. Setting the remote participants positions is required in conferences that use the individual spatial audio style. In these conferences, if a remote participant does not have an established location, the participant does not have a default position and will remain muted until a position is specified. The shared spatial audio style does not support setting the remote participants' positions. In conferences that use the shared style, the spatial scene is shared by all participants, so that each client can set a position and participate in the shared scene.
For example, if a local participant Eric, who uses the individual spatial audio style and does not have a set direction, calls setSpatialPosition(VoxeetSDK.session.participant, {x:3,y:0,z:0}), Eric hears audio from the position (3,0,0). If Eric also calls setSpatialPosition(Sophia, {x:7,y:1,z:2}), he hears Sophia from the position (7,1,2). In this case, Eric hears Sophia 4 meters to the right, 1 meter above, and 2 meters in front.
For more information about spatial audio, see the Spatial Audio guide.
member.param: The selected participant. Using the local participant sets the location from which the participant will hear a conference. Using a remote participant sets the position from which the participant's audio will be rendered.
The participant's audio location.
member.returns: A that represents the asynchronous operation.

member.name: T:DolbyIO.Comms.Services.MediaDeviceService
member.summary:
The media device service provides access to set the input and output audio devices as well as getting notifications about the added and removed devices.
To use the media device service, follow these steps: 1. Get all current audio devices using the method. 2. Set the desired input audio device by calling the method. 3. Set the desired output audio device by calling the method. 4. Subscribe to the , , and events.

member.summary: Sets the that is raised when a video device is removed from the system.

member.summary: Disables the local participant's audio and stops sending the audio to a conference.

member.summary: Stops sending the local participant's audio to the conference. The mute method does not notify the server to stop audio stream transmission.
member.param: A boolean value that indicates the required mute state. True mutes the microphone, false un-mutes the microphone.
member.returns: A that represents the asynchronous operation.
member.remarks: To stop sending audio to the conference, use the stopAudio method.

member.name: T:DolbyIO.Comms.Services.RemoteAudioService
member.summary: The remote audio service allows to mute selected remote participants (Non-Dolby Voice conferences only) and stop and start receiving audio from remote participants.

member.name: M:DolbyIO.Comms.Services.RemoteAudioService.MuteAsync(System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Stops playing the specified remote participants' audio to the local participant. The mute method does not notify the server to stop audio stream transmission. To stop receiving an audio stream from the server, use the StopAsync method.
member.param: A boolean value that indicates the required mute state. True mutes the remote participant, false un-mutes the remote participant.
The identifier of the remote participant whose audio should not be played.
member.returns: A that represents the asynchronous operation.
member.remarks: Attention: This method is only available in non-Dolby Voice conferences.

member.name: P:DolbyIO.Comms.Services.VideoService.Remote

member.name: T:DolbyIO.Comms.Services.LocalVideoService
member.summary: The LocalVideoService is responsible for capturing the local participant's video and sending the video into a conference.

member.name: M:DolbyIO.Comms.Services.LocalVideoService.StartAsync(System.Nullable{DolbyIO.Comms.VideoDevice},DolbyIO.Comms.VideoFrameHandler)
member.summary:
Starts capturing the local participant's video.
You can call this method any time, regardless of the conference state. If this method is invoked when there's no active conference, the method selects a camera and sets a video frame handler. If the video frame handler has a video sink, the camera starts delivering frames to the sink.
This method also allows switching cameras. If you passed a VideoFrameHandler to the previous start call and would like to continue using that handler, you must pass the same handler into the subsequent call to switch cameras. This action just switches cameras and keeps the rest of the pipeline in tact.
An application is responsible for the frame handler and must not delete the handler or its sink until the handler invokes the StopAsync() method and the StopAsync() method execution is finished.
If the application uses a null VideoDevice, then the SDk uses the first video device found in the system.
If this method returns an error, the application can safely delete the provided frame handler.
If the application starts the video while not in a conference and joins the conference later, the conference's local video state is determined by the MediaConstraints passed to the conference::join() method. In this situation, it is possible to start the local camera preview, but it is not possible not to join the conference with video. In order to enable video later , you have to call the start() method again. It is not possible to stop sending video into the conference while keeping the local camera preview..
member.param: The device for capturing video or null.
The VideoFrameHandler for receiving the local video frames.
member.returns: A that represents the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:DolbyIO.Comms.Services.LocalVideoService.StopAsync
member.summary: Stops local video capture.
member.returns: A that represents the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:DolbyIO.Comms.Services.LocalVideoService.StartScreenShareAsync(DolbyIO.Comms.ScreenShareSource,DolbyIO.Comms.VideoFrameHandler)
member.summary:
Starts local capture of screen share.
This method may be called only if a conference is active.
This method can also be used to switch screen share sources at any point. If you have passed in a to the previous start call and would like to continue using this handler, you must pass the same handler into the subsequent call used to switch sources. This will have the effect of just switching sources, keeping the rest of the pipeline in tact.
The SDK supports switching seamlesly between various screen capture sources, without readding a video track to the peer connection. However, if switching from low resolution Window capture to high resolution Fullscreen capture the Window capture screen share must be stopped before the Fullscreen capture can be started.
member.param: The screen source to capture from.
The video frames handler.
member.returns: A that represents the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:DolbyIO.Comms.Services.LocalVideoService.StopScreenShareAsync
member.summary: Stops the screen share capture.
member.returns: A that represents the asynchronous operation.

member.name: T:DolbyIO.Comms.Services.RemoteVideoService
member.summary: The RemoteVideoService allows the local participant to locally start and stop remote participants` video streams transmission.

member.name: M:DolbyIO.Comms.Services.RemoteVideoService.SetVideoSinkAsync(DolbyIO.Comms.VideoTrack,DolbyIO.Comms.VideoSink)
member.summary: Sets a video sink to allow passing decoded video frames to an application. The set sink is used in all conferences. An application is responsible for the sink and the SDK does not delete it. The application should set a null sink and ensure that the SetVideoSinkAsync() call returns before deleting the previously set sink object.
member.param: The VideoTrack to be attached to.
The VideoSink used to receive video frames.
member.returns: A that represents the asynchronous operation.
